page.title: 05THE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The Sewage Works lie immediately to the north of Riverside Park.Only one man is employed by the Water and Drainage Department of Borders Regional Council. The sewage arrives in a 76cms diameter pipe deep in the ground and a screw lifts the sludge to the grit channels which carry the lighter material to the comminutor.As the drum goes round,the heavy stuff is chopped up.A channel then takes the sludge to the two filter ponds where the heavier materials sink to the bottom and are drained off.The ponds are 180cms.deep at the edge and 300cms deep in middle. The Activated Sludge Tanks encourage the growth of bacteria to help purify the water.Methane gas,obtained in the process,heats the water,and the pure water is channelled to the R.Jed.
